DOC.brief_title: Calcineurin Inhibitor ( CNI ) -Free Immunosuppressive Regimen T1D Patients Receiving Islet Transplantation
DOC.detailed_description: We design clinical trial single-arm , phase 1-2 trial conduct two transplant center ( San Raffaele Scientific Institute , Milan , Italy ; Cell Isolation Transplantation Center , University Geneva , Geneva , Switzerland ) use common protocol islet preparation , post-transplantation patient management data collection . The trial exploratory nature target enrollment 10 patient . The recruitment competitive two center patient receive least 10,000 IE/kg . Up three islet infusion allow per patient insulin independence reach , provide partial islet function ( i.e. , fast C-peptide ≥0.3 ng/mL ) maintain infusion . We plan individual follow-up 3 year last islet infusion . Patients type 1 diabetes eligible study . Major criterion inclusion : age 18-65 year ; type 1 diabetes onset < 40 year age ; insulin treatment least 5 year time enrollment ; stimulate C-peptide response arginine < 0.5 ng/ml ; multiple ( three ) daily insulin injection Continuous Subcutaneous Insulin Infusion ; self-blood glucose monitoring ≥3 times/day ; high glycemic instability and/or hypoglycemia unawareness ; inability consistently attain glycated hemoglobin target < 7.5 % without severe hypoglycemia ( defined hypoglycemic episode require assistance another person resolution ) past 36 month despite medical management diabetes specialist . Major criterion exclusion : HbA1c > 12 % ; BMI > 30 kg/m2 , insulin requirement > 0.8 IU/kg/day ; poorly control hypertension ; untreated proliferative diabetic retinopathy ; presence history macroalbuminuria ( > 300mg/g day ) estimate glomerular filtration rate < 60 ml/min/1.73 m2 female < 70 ml/min/1.73 m2 male .
